HostProperties.tag: Microsoft Windows XP Service Pack 2 Microsoft Windows XP Service Pack 3

ReportItem.pluginName: MS10-054: Vulnerabilities in SMB Server Could Allow Remote Code Execution (982214) (remote check)
ReportItem.description: The remote host is affected by several vulnerabilities in the SMB server that may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or perform a denial of service against the remote host. These vulnerabilities depend on access to a shared drive, but do not necessarily require credentials.
ReportItem.plugin_name: MS10-054: Vulnerabilities in SMB Server Could Allow Remote Code Execution (982214) (remote check)
ReportItem.solution:
Microsoft has released a set of patches for Windows XP, Vista, 2008, 7, and 2008 R2 :
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/MS10-054
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to execute arbitrary code on the remote Windows host due to flaws in its SMB implementation.

ReportItem.pluginName: MS10-012: Vulnerabilities in SMB Could Allow Remote Code Execution (971468) (uncredentialed check)
ReportItem.description:
The remote host is affected by several vulnerabilities in the SMB server that may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or perform a denial of service against the remote host.
These vulnerabilities depend on access to a shared drive, but do not necessarily require credentials.
ReportItem.plugin_name: MS10-012: Vulnerabilities in SMB Could Allow Remote Code Execution (971468) (uncredentialed check)
ReportItem.solution:
Microsoft has released a set of patches for Windows 2000, XP, 2003, Vista, 2008, 7, and 2008 R2 :
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/MS10-012
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to execute arbitrary code on the remote Windows host due to flaws in its SMB implementation.

ReportItem.pluginName: MS11-020: Vulnerability in SMB Server Could Allow Remote Code Execution (2508429) (remote check)
ReportItem.description: The remote host is affected by a vulnerability in the SMB server that may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or perform a denial of service against the remote host. This vulnerability depends on access to a Windows file share, but does not necessarily require credentials.
ReportItem.plugin_name: MS11-020: Vulnerability in SMB Server Could Allow Remote Code Execution (2508429) (remote check)
ReportItem.solution:
Microsoft has released a set of patches for Windows XP, Vista, 2008, 7, and 2008 R2 :
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms11-020
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to execute arbitrary code on the remote Windows host due to flaws in its SMB implementation.

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB Shares Unprivileged Access
ReportItem.description:
The remote has one or more Windows shares that can be accessed through the network with the given credentials.
Depending on the share rights, it may allow an attacker to read/write confidential data.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB Shares Unprivileged Access
ReportItem.solution: To restrict access under Windows, open Explorer, do a right click on each share, go to the 'sharing' tab, and click on 'permissions'.
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to access a network share.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The following shares can be accessed as lbbiwmgm :
- filez - (readable) + Content of this share : .. test.txt troubleshooting.pcap

ReportItem.pluginName: SMB Use Host SID to Enumerate Local Users
ReportItem.description: Using the host security identifier (SID), it is possible to enumerate local users on the remote Windows system.
ReportItem.plugin_name: SMB Use Host SID to Enumerate Local Users
ReportItem.solution: n/a
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to enumerate local users.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
- Administrator (id 500, Administrator account) - Guest (id 501, Guest account) - HelpAssistant (id 1000) - HelpServicesGroup (id 1001) - SUPPORT_388945a0 (id 1002) - winxpPro (id 1003)
Note that, in addition to the Administrator and Guest accounts, Nessus has enumerated only those local users with IDs between 1000 and 1200. To use a different range, edit the scan policy and change the 'Start UID' and/or 'End UID' preferences for this plugin, then re-run the scan.

ReportItem.pluginName: MS05-027: Vulnerability in SMB Could Allow Remote Code Execution (896422) (uncredentialed check)
ReportItem.description:
The remote version of Windows contains a flaw in the Server Message Block (SMB) implementation that may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the remote host.
An attacker does not need to be authenticated to exploit this flaw.
ReportItem.plugin_name: MS05-027: Vulnerability in SMB Could Allow Remote Code Execution (896422) (uncredentialed check)
ReportItem.solution:
Microsoft has released a set of patches for Windows 2000, XP and 2003 :
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms05-027
ReportItem.synopsis: Arbitrary code can be executed on the remote host due to a flaw in the SMB implementation.

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB LsaQueryInformationPolicy Function SID Enumeration
ReportItem.description:
By emulating the call to LsaQueryInformationPolicy(), it was possible to obtain the host SID (Security Identifier).
The host SID can then be used to get the list of local users.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB LsaQueryInformationPolicy Function SID Enumeration
ReportItem.solution:
You can prevent anonymous lookups of the host SID by setting the 'RestrictAnonymous' registry setting to an appropriate value.
Refer to the 'See also' section for guidance.
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to obtain the host SID for the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The remote host SID value is :
1-5-21-1220945662-1801674531-839522115
The value of 'RestrictAnonymous' setting is : unknown

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB Fully Accessible Registry Detection
ReportItem.description:
Nessus did not access the remote registry completely, because this needs to be logged in as administrator.
If you want the permissions / values of all the sensitive registry keys to be checked for, we recommend that you fill the 'SMB Login' options in the 'Windows credentials' section of the policy by the administrator login name and password.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB Fully Accessible Registry Detection
ReportItem.solution: Use an administrator level account for scanning.
ReportItem.synopsis: Nessus had insufficient access to the remote registry.

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB Registry Remotely Accessible
ReportItem.description: It was possible to access the remote Windows Registry using the login / password combination used for the Windows local checks (SMB tests).
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB Registry Remotely Accessible
ReportItem.solution: n/a
ReportItem.synopsis: Access the remote Windows Registry.

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB Shares Enumeration
ReportItem.description: By connecting to the remote host, Nessus was able to enumerate the network share names.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB Shares Enumeration
ReportItem.solution: N/A
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to enumerate remote network shares.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Here are the SMB shares available on the remote host when logged as lbbiwmgm:
- IPC$ - filez - ADMIN$ - C$

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB LanMan Pipe Server Listing Disclosure
ReportItem.description: It was possible to obtain the browse list of the remote Windows system by sending a request to the LANMAN pipe. The browse list is the list of the nearest Windows systems of the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB LanMan Pipe Server Listing Disclosure
ReportItem.solution: n/a
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to obtain network information.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Here is the browse list of the remote host :
WINXP-95C9409AB ( os : 5.1 )

ReportItem.pluginName: MS09-001: Microsoft Windows SMB Vulnerabilities Remote Code Execution (958687) (uncredentialed check)
ReportItem.description: The remote host is affected by a memory corruption vulnerability in SMB that may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or perform a denial of service against the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_name: MS09-001: Microsoft Windows SMB Vulnerabilities Remote Code Execution (958687) (uncredentialed check)
ReportItem.solution:
Microsoft has released a set of patches for Windows 2000, XP, 2003, Vista and 2008 :
http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms09-001.mspx
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to crash the remote host due to a flaw in SMB.

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB NULL Session Authentication
ReportItem.description:
The remote host is running Microsoft Windows. It is possible to log into it using a NULL session (i.e., with no login or password).
Depending on the configuration, it may be possible for an unauthenticated, remote attacker to leverage this issue to get information about the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB NULL Session Authentication
ReportItem.solution:
Apply the following registry changes per the referenced Technet advisories :
Set : - HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA\RestrictAnonymous=1 - HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\lanmanserver\parameters\restrictnullsessaccess=1
Remove BROWSER from : - HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\lanmanserver\parameters\NullSessionPipes
Reboot once the registry changes are complete.
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to log into the remote Windows host with a NULL session.
ReportItem.plugin_output: It was possible to bind to the \browser pipe

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB Guest Account Local User Access
ReportItem.description: The remote host is running one of the Microsoft Windows operating systems. It was possible to log into it as a guest user using a random account.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB Guest Account Local User Access
ReportItem.solution: In the group policy change the setting for 'Network access: Sharing and security model for local accounts' from 'Guest only - local users authenticate as Guest' to 'Classic - local users authenticate as themselves'.
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to log into the remote host.

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB Log In Possible
ReportItem.description:
The remote host is running Microsoft Windows operating system or Samba, a CIFS/SMB server for Unix. It was possible to log into it using one of the following accounts :
- NULL session - Guest account - Given Credentials
ReportItem.metasploit_name: Microsoft Windows Authenticated User Code Execution
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB Log In Possible
ReportItem.solution: n/a
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to log into the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_output: - NULL sessions are enabled on the remote host - Remote users are authenticated as 'Guest'

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB NativeLanManager Remote System Information Disclosure
ReportItem.description: It is possible to get the remote operating system name and version (Windows and/or Samba) by sending an authentication request to port 139 or 445.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB NativeLanManager Remote System Information Disclosure
ReportItem.solution: n/a
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to obtain information about the remote operating system.
ReportItem.plugin_output: The remote Operating System is : Windows 5.1 The remote native lan manager is : Windows 2000 LAN Manager The remote SMB Domain Name is : WINXP-95C9409AB

ReportItem.pluginName: Windows NetBIOS / SMB Remote Host Information Disclosure
ReportItem.description:
The remote host listens on UDP port 137 or TCP port 445 and replies to NetBIOS nbtscan or SMB requests.
Note that this plugin gathers information to be used in other plugins but does not itself generate a report.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Windows NetBIOS / SMB Remote Host Information Disclosure
ReportItem.solution: n/a
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to obtain the network name of the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The following 6 NetBIOS names have been gathered :
WINXP-95C9409AB = Computer name WORKGROUP = Workgroup / Domain name WINXP-95C9409AB = File Server Service WORKGROUP = Browser Service Elections WORKGROUP = Master Browser __MSBROWSE__ = Master Browser
The remote host has the following MAC address on its adapter : 52:54:00:00:ee:5c

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB Service Detection
ReportItem.description: The remote service understands the CIFS (Common Internet File System) or Server Message Block (SMB) protocol, used to provide shared access to files, printers, etc between nodes on a network.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB Service Detection
ReportItem.solution: n/a
ReportItem.synopsis: A file / print sharing service is listening on the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_output: An SMB server is running on this port.

ReportItem.pluginName: Microsoft Windows SMB Service Detection
ReportItem.description: The remote service understands the CIFS (Common Internet File System) or Server Message Block (SMB) protocol, used to provide shared access to files, printers, etc between nodes on a network.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Microsoft Windows SMB Service Detection
ReportItem.solution: n/a
ReportItem.synopsis: A file / print sharing service is listening on the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_output: A CIFS server is running on this port.

ReportItem.pluginName: Nessus TCP scanner
ReportItem.description:
This plugin is a classical TCP port scanner. It shall be reasonably quick even against a firewalled target.
Once a TCP connection is open, it grabs any available banner for the service identification plugins.
Note that TCP scanners are more intrusive than SYN (half open) scanners.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Nessus TCP scanner
ReportItem.solution: Protect your target with an IP filter.
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to determine which TCP ports are open.
ReportItem.plugin_output: Port 3389/tcp was found to be open

ReportItem.pluginName: Nessus TCP scanner
ReportItem.description:
This plugin is a classical TCP port scanner. It shall be reasonably quick even against a firewalled target.
Once a TCP connection is open, it grabs any available banner for the service identification plugins.
